p: To identify which, if any, of these molecular traits were related to disease progression, we assessed their relationship to clinical-pathological variables. The C1 module eigenprotein was negatively correlated with amyloid plaques, Consortium to Establish a Registry for Alzheimer’s Disease (CERAD) score ( Mirra et al., 1991) (BLSA data, ρ = −0.40, p = 1.0e–4) and neurofibrillary tangles, and Braak score ( Braak and Braak, 1991) (BLSA data, ρ = −0.45, p = 9.7e–6) across cases and controls ( Figures 3C and 3D; Table S4). In contrast, the C8 module eigen-protein was positively correlated with CERAD score (ACT data, ρ = 0.52, p = 2.9e–5) and Braak score (ACT data, ρ = 0.52, p = 2.9e–5) and anti-correlated with cognitive status (Cognitive Abilities Screening Instrument [CASI] score; Teng et al., 1994) (ACT data, ρ = −0.55, p = 7.7e–6) ( Figures 3J– 3L; Table S4). A similar pattern was observed for the C10 module ( Figures 3R– 3T; Table S4) and similar trends were observed with the other study cohorts ( Figures S1B– S1Q and S2; Table S4).
